title: Patcher stuck at 32%
body:
Got online tonight to play league and needed to patch the update for 5.6 (urf update to it i believe) and it stopped at 32% and popped up a message 'Update Failed - Unspecified error occured. Please check logs for more information.'

i have tried doing everything the site ' https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202969434-Patching-Issues ' says will help and nothing has. Does anyone know anything else that may help?

replies.body:
How strange, more people are getting this.

1. Go to Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_air_client\releases\ and enter the folder with the highest number (should be easy enough to work out, unless you've been here since beta and never once repaired your client).
2. Create a new, empty file in the latest version folder named "S_OK", with no extension. This can be done by creating a new text document, and then renaming it to remove the ".txt" at the end.
3. Run the patcher in admin mode. You might get a glitch the first time around, just open it again and it should work.

Best of luck.

Hello,

I was expiriencing the exact same problem! 
I had created a new text document in the latest folder inside my C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_air_client\releases\0.0.1.138 and i named it S_OK. 

I restarted my computer and when i started up the launcher the download would start and finish succesfully. 

But when i wanted to launch to the accutual login screen it gave the next error: 0001: Failed loading mod/win/ClientWindow.dat due to invalid dependencieslib.external.dat.champion_select. in a special window.

After this i did another repair, after that the game is fixed and i am now able to play agian!

Thank you very much for your help!

By glitch I was talking about the "Unspecified error" dialogue appearing again, not that stuff you seem to have gotten. Maybe you had a combination of errors in your client?

Anyway, glad to see that you were able to fix it. Also, for future reference, use the "Reply" feature of the boards to reply to someone, otherwise they won't get notification of your message!
